info.name: Game Jolt API
info.description:
A complete collection of Game Jolt API Version 1.0 calls in POSTMAN for testing.
See: http://gamejolt.com/api/doc/game for complete documentation.
Or https://github.com/gamejolt/game-api-libraries for the latest API implementations.

request.description:
Returns data from the Data Store.

Note that we suggest using the dump format for returning data from this call.
Sets data in the Data Store.
Updates data in the Data Store.
Removes data from the Data Store.
Returns all the keys in either the game's global data store, or all the keys in a user's data store.
Returns a list of scores either for a user or globally for a game.
Adds a score for a user or guest.
Returns a list of high score tables for a game.

Opens a game session for a particular user. Allows you to tell Game Jolt that a user is playing your game. You must ping the session to keep it active and you must close it when you're done with it. Note that you can only have one open session at a time. If you try to open a new session while one is running, the system will close out your current one before opening a new one.

Pings an open session to tell the system that it's still active. If the session hasn't been pinged within 120 seconds, the system will close the session and you will have to open another one. It's recommended that you ping every 30 seconds or so to keep the system from cleaning up your session. You can also let the system know whether the player is in an "active" or "idle" state within your game through this call.
Returns either one trophy, or multiple trophies, depending on the parameters passed in.
Sets a trophy as achieved for a particular user.
Authenticates the user's information. This should be done before you make any calls for the user, to make sure that the user's credentials (username/token) are valid.
